result.execSummary:
The defendant Aziz H Noon-Abdullah was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver THC (>2500-10,000g) [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(h)4.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If revoked, same condiitons apply to extended supervision as conditions of proabtion, except for condition time.

miscConds.notes: Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, and assessments, to be paid within 18 months of probation or serve 10 days in the HOC.
Maintain full time employment, school, or a combination of both.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.

No contact with Wali A. in person or thru a third party.
No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.

Continue with drug treatment (aftercare).
Any other conditions department deemed necessary.
Court ordered that defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.

Maintain absolute sobriety, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.
Defendant to be tested once per month while on probation.

records.addlTxt: Decision and order DENYING motion for good time credit signed and filed. Copies given to the District Attorney and defense counsel.
Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, this request/motion is hereby assigned to the Hon. Clare L. Fiorenza, Br. 3, for review. mag
Defendant's pro se motion for good time credit.
Court takes no action on motion to modify sentence, as court has been advised that the defendant is being released for work.  aw

Per order of Presiding Judge, Felony Division, the defendant's motion to modify sentence filed on 2/16/15 [file first returned to shelf] is hereby assigned to the Hon. Clare L. Fiorenza, Br. 3, for review.*   jbs
Motion To Modify Sentence Filed By Attorney Bridget J. Krause

Defendant Aziz H Noon-Abdullah in court with attorney Bridget Joy Krause.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 8 YEARS, with credit for 0 DAYS time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 4 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 4 YEARS.  The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program or the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.  If defendant is revoked, same conditions apply to extended supervision as conditions of probation, except for the condition time.

The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 4 YEARS with the following conditions:

- Serve 10 MONTHS UP FRONT CONDITION TIME CONSECUTIVE, in the House of Correction - with huber for work, meeting with agent, community service, and treatment.  

REPORT IN DATE:  FEBRUARY 4, 2015 BY NOON.
If defendant fails to report, ALL COMMUNITY ACCESS IS CANCELLED.

- 60 DAYS, IMPOSED and STAYED, CONSECUTIVE in the House of Correction to be used by the agent for any violations.  
- Continue with drug treatment. (aftercare)
- Maintain absolute sobriety, no controlled substances without a valid prescription, with random drug tests and breathalyzers.  Defendant to be tested once per month while on probation.
- Maintain full time employment, school, or a combination of both.
- Complete 40 hours of community service each year. (160 hours total)
- No contact with Wali A. in person or thru a third party.
- No association with known drug users or dealers, and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
- Court ordered defendant to provide a DNA sample, and pay all MANDATORY COURT costs, fees, and assessments, to be paid within 18 months of probation or serve 10 days in the HOC.  
- Any other conditions department deemed necessary.

Court ordered that the defendant cannot vote until civil rights are restored upon completion of sentence.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon that he may never possess a firearm.
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.

Received and filed:
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Sentencing Referral Form;
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.  aw
Documents for sentencing, received and filed.  aw
Letter from attorney Krause, and drug screens from Assuance laboratories, LLC.

Defendant Aziz H Noon-Abdullah in court with attorney Bridget J. Krause.  Karl Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case scheduled for sentencing.  Case adjourned due to congested calendar to 1/29/2015 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Aziz H Noon-Abdullah in court with attorney Bridget J. Krause.  Karl P. Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
BRANCH 22 FOR BRANCH 3.  Case in court for final pre-trial, defense wishes to move forward with a plea.
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.    
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 3.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for November 14, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Letters in support for sentencing, treatment records, and drug tests, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Aziz H Noon-Abdullah in court with attorney Bridget J. Krause.  Antonella Aleman appeared for the State of Wisconsin for Karl Hayes.
Case scheduled for plea hearing.  Court is in trial.  Attorney Hayes is unavailable.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea on 8/25/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Agreed Upon Request for a New Court Date is signed and filed.  aw  Plea hearing scheduled for August 25, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Aziz H Noon-Abdullah in court with attorney Bridget J Krause.  Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has no motions to be filed.  Case adjourned for projected guilty plea 8/13/2014 at 1:30 pm, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Plea hearing scheduled for August 13, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defense counsel needs time to go over discovery with client.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 6/5/2014 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court ordered all motions be filed by the next court date.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 5, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Aziz H Noon-Abdullah in court with attorney Bridget J Krause.  Nathaniel Adamson for Karl P Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for 04-28-2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT DOES QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.
